Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed streaky black below; exterior: white slip; broken maeander pattern around rim above two lines; below: painted decoration consisting of head and neck of goose, to right; at right, part of wing of second goose, to right; pendant roundel and rosette as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Aphrodite Bowl
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as part of the Group of the Aphrodite Bowl, rather than as by the painter of the bowl, because the sherd displays a greater amount of variety in the filling ornaments, albeit similar to those on the Aphrodite Bowl (Lemos 1991, 74-5).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 17)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 74, p. 233, no. 125.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0374) (phase 2)
